message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.GR, cs.HC 

The paper deals with learning and tracking the 3D body shape of infants from RGB-D sequences, which involves computer vision (CV) and robotics (RO) techniques. The authors use statistical models to represent the body shape and pose of infants, which falls under the category of machine learning (LG). The paper also discusses the applicability of their method in clinical practice for early detection of neurodevelopmental disorders in infants, which relates to healthcare (HC) and graphics (GR) as well. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV, followed by cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.GR, and cs.HC.
